page.title: 07Sandringham Stud
page.content:
The Royal Stud exists for the purpose of breeding racehorses. No current runners are kept there, but about thirty breeding mares are housed at any one time. Foals are born in boxes equipped with closed-circuit T.V. so that a constant watch can be maintained. The latest electronic equipment is used to monitor their health and development. A vetinary surgeon visits the stud daily and the blacksmith monthly.
The most notable horse resident at the present time is Shirley Heights, winner of the 1978 Derby. Other horses from France, Ireland, Italy and America are regularly sent to Sandringham for breeding. Visitors to the stud are greeted by the splendid statue of Persimon, winner of many 'Classics' in the last century.
